settings.title: Save Big on LED Lighting Upgrades

settings.html:
PSE&G Utility Customers

We Help You Get Lighting for Less

To encourage energy-efficient lighting upgrades, New Jersey utility company Public Service Electric and Gas (PSE&G) is providing substantial incentives for qualifying lighting retrofits & replacements as well as occupancy and daylight sensors and advanced lighting controls.

Many companies aren't aware of these rebates or how to access them. Whether you could use new lights in a single office or across an entire industrial complex, or if you have commercial clients you'll be speccing or installing new lights for, ELEDLights can help you access every energy incentive available to the project.

settings.title: Upgrade the lighting in your facility to super-efficient LEDs for just $1 per fixture: Get no-hassle, instant savings.
Stay competitive, win more jobs, and help your customers with cost-reducing instant utility rebates.
Take control of your lighting costs and drastically increase savings without having to do the rebate processing yourself.

settings.title: Find Out How Much We Can Save You
What PSE&G Incentives?
settings.html:
Businesses, schools, hospitals, and other organizations, both public and private, are all looking to reduce their overhead and better manage their costs. One easy way to do that is through a lighting upgrade from old technology to new ultra-efficient lighting. Property developers can also benefit by including advanced lighting upgrades as part of building renovations.

Upgrading to efficient LED lighting doesn’t have to be a hassle or expensive. In fact, end users can save 50% or more in energy overhead while enjoying reduced maintenance costs for the life of the lighting. Savings can be even bigger when advanced lighting controls are part of the upgrade.

What many companies miss out on is the potential for sizable up-front savings through energy incentives programs

Federal funds have been made available to states to incentivize the use of high-efficiency lighting. These funds are distributed through utility companies, such as PSE&G.

When you take advantage of energy efficiency incentives available to your project through PSE&G, you can save on not only the cost of your new lights but also on occupancy & daylight sensors and advanced lighting controls that bring you even more energy savings.

Take control of energy use with ELEDLights & PSE&G incentives!

ELEDLights has helped local companies like yours access these energy efficiency incentives to offset the cost of lighting upgrades, at no additional cost to them. If your project qualifies for rebates, we can can help make submitting your applications—and getting your incentive—fast and easy.

settings.title: What's the Deal with PECO and PSE&G Rebates?
settings.content:
Upgrading to energy-efficient LED doesn’t have to be a hassle or expensive. In fact, end users will save 50% or more on average in monthly energy overhead alone while enjoying reduced maintenance costs for the life of the lighting. An existing business can cut its overhead with an upgrade, and property developers regularly do lighting upgrades as part of renovations.

What most companies miss out on, though, is the potential for easy, free, and sizable up-front savings. Federal funds have been made available to states to incentivize the use of high-efficiency lighting. These funds are distributed through utility companies, such as Pennsylvania's PECO utility and New Jersey's PSE&G.

When you take advantage of all utility rebates available to your project through PECO and PSE&G, the cost of a lighting upgrade can be reduced to a little as $1/fixture plus sales tax.

ELEDLights has helped countless customers access these incentives to offset the cost of their lighting upgrades, at no additional cost to the customer. If your project qualifies for rebates, we can often even make it so that your rebate is applied to your lights as part of the purchase process, so that you never pay the full price of the lights out of your pocket.

settings.title: What Projects Qualify for Incentives?
settings.html:
If you are installing lighting in a commercial building in the PSE&G service area, there is a good chance your project will be eligible for cost-saving rebates. PSE&G offers incentives for commercial, industrial and institutional customers who install high-efficiency lighting and energy-saving controls. If you're unsure if your project qualifies, reach out to us and ask. Our team puts together incentive discounts for local companies all the time. We can probably get you a faster answer than your utility can—plus we can tell you how much you stand to save on the lighting and controls for your project.

Use one of the Get Started buttons above to tell us about your project—free of charge, no commitment required!

settings.title: What Projects Qualify for Money Back?
settings.content:
If you are installing lighting in a commercial building in the PECO or PSE&G service areas, there is good chance your project will be eligible for cost-saving rebates. If you're unsure, just reach out to us and ask. Our team puts together rebate savings for local companies all the time. We can probably get you a faster answer than your utility can—plus we can tell you exactly how much you'll save on the lights for your project.

Use one of the Get Started buttons above to tell us about your project—free of charge, no commitment required!

settings.title: What's It Like to Get Incentives through ELEDLights?

settings.subheading: Team Toyota of Glen Mills, PA
settings.title: Dealership Saves on Lighting Improvements
settings.content: "PECO was offering energy credits. ELEDLights literally did everything for me, to the point where when they sold me the lights, the credits were already on there. Just an absolute wealth of knowledge. I couldn't recommend them enough to anybody that's looking to do any sort of project, large or small."

settings.subheading: Iron Stone Real Estate Partners, Philadelphia
settings.title: Parking garage upgrade saved $64,500 through PECO rebates
settings.content: Iron Stone replaced 430 HPS canopy lights in a parking garage. The rebates we got them amounted to $64,500, leaving just $430 to be paid out of pocket for the new, energy-efficient fixtures. And the energy efficiency paid off too! After just 2 months, Iron Stone estimated they'd already saved more than a thousand dollars in energy costs.

settings.subheading: Kristoff’s Classic Cars of Horsham, PA
settings.title: $8 Lighting Upgrade for Car Bay
settings.content: When Tom Kristoff upgraded 8 lights in the car bay with LED lights, we were able to save him 99% of the fixture costs by filing for the utility incentives available to him. Total bill: $8 + tax.
